title: Verify whether able to enable a Digital Wallet Item from the Package Order> Digital Wallet Item Modal if all existing cards are disabled

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to Pv application
2. Navigate to Ticket Services and pull up an order with Auto-Renewal
3. Click on the â€˜Auto-Renewalâ€™ icon
4. The Package Order Information modal will open.
5. If there is not a default â€˜Default Digital Wallet Itemâ€™ on file, a message will appear â€˜Required: Please specify a default digital wallet item.â€™
6. Click on the wallet icon next to the error message to open up the Digital Wallet Item Modal
7. Note that both of the cards on file have a status of â€˜Disabledâ€™.
8. Click on the â€˜Editâ€™ icon next to one of the cards.
9. Attempt to change the status from â€˜Disabledâ€™ to â€˜Enabledâ€™
10. Click â€˜Apply Changesâ€™
11. Note an error message â€˜No Default Patron Card On File exists for this patron for auto renewal.
12. Unable to set the â€˜Defaultâ€™ boolean to true from this spot since the box is not activated for action

14. Click on the Digital Wallet Item tab from within Patron Management
15. Change the Payment Type dropdown to â€˜Credit Cardâ€™ and click the Boolean to â€˜Show Disabledâ€™ cards
16. Click the â€˜Editâ€™ icon next to one of the cards
17. Note that the Wallet Item details populate
18. Changed the Status dropdown from â€˜Disabledâ€™ to â€˜Enabledâ€™
19. Note that the â€˜Defaultâ€™ Boolean is now actionable
20. Click â€˜Saveâ€™ to save changes
21. Now navigate back to the order in Ticket Services
22. Click on the Auto-Renewal Icon once again
23. In the Package Order Information modal, click the wallet icon
24. Note that now that once a card is set as default, the other card can now be â€˜Enabledâ€™, saved, and then set to default

title: Verify a promotion can be used without a coupon code If all coupons for a promotion are set to inactive

I). Promotion creation: Ticketing Setup --> Promotion Administration --> Click on New button and create new 
Promotion
II). Event admin --> Promotion tab --> Search for the above promotion and add the same 
III). Promotion admin --> Select the above promotion --> Go to Events tab --> Search above event and add the same
IV). Promotion admin --> Select the above promotion --> Buyer type --> Search the buyer type and add the same
V). Promotion admin --> Select the above promotion --> coupon code --> Create a new coupon code and make 
status as inactive
2. Login to PV Application with valid credentials
3. Navigate to Ticket sales portal from ticketing tab
4. Search for the event EVT1 for which promotions are associated

8. Complete the transaction

2. User should able to log into pv Application
3. Navigate to ticket sale portal successfully
4. The event which promotions are associate should be display in search result
5. The promotion code should be selected under promotion dropdown
6. Seats should be loced successfully
7. User should not enter coupon code in transaction
8. The transaction should be completed successfully
9. User should able to complete the transaction without provided coupon code

title: Verify the Switch Timeout error

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Setup a multiple credit cards for Fusebox server
2. Enable the DEBUG mode in the log file to catch fusebox messages
3. Trans Type 22 (Inquiry) enable by setting property "Fusebox.provider.inquiry.call.enabled" to true.
2. Launch PV Application
3. Run a $70 sale using a terminal that has been setup in Demo Mode within Fusebox.
4. Using Visa card number 4242424242424242 will cause the transaction to hang indefinitely.
5. Verify the Switch Timeout error
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Site should be launched
3. setup should be done
4. Transaction should hang
5. When the POS sees this particular error (Field 1003 = 88), it should know that it needs to automatically trigger a Transaction Inquiry.  The response message you will get back should be "NO RECORDS FOUND", which indicates that the original transaction never made it through.
